meta.hint:
A pronoun is a word that takes the place of a noun or nouns. Use 'he' and 'him' for one boy or man. John is here. Example - He sees you. Example - You see him.
Use 'she' and 'her' for one girl or woman. Kate is here. Example - She sees you. Example - You see her.
Use 'it' for one thing. There is a rabbit here. Example - It sees you. Example - You see it.
Use 'we' and 'us' for more than one person, with I or me. John and I are here. Example - We see you. Example - You see us.
Use 'they' and 'them' for more than one person or thing. John and Kate are here. Example - They see you. Example - You see them.

content.description: Sonam and Ritika are in Pune. I will meet _____ today.
Mom and I went to the market. ___ bought some vegetables.
